title: Are You Aware Dowry Is Illegal? Nikki Bhati's Father's Chilling Response
content: Six decades after dowry was banned in India, a 28-year-old woman living less than an hour from national capital Delhi was burnt alive, allegedly by her husband and mother-in-law, over a demand of getting Rs 36 lakh from her parents as dowry.

title: 2 Jobless Brothers, Sisters Stuck In Marriage And Cycle Of Dowry Abuse
content: Greed knows no boundaries. Vipin and Rohit Bhati, two unemployed brothers who lived off their father's grocery shop, got a high-end SUV, a Royal Enfield bike, nearly 500 gm gold and cash from their in-laws, but this was not enough

title: "I Did It": US Man Kills 18-Year-Old Daughter, Wraps Body In Pride Flag
content: The accused, Delbert Cornish, was taken into police custody in Mountain Home and then moved to Canyon County jail on Tuesday.

title: India's Crude Oil Imports Dropped To Near 18-Month Low In July: Report
content: India's crude oil imports fell 8.7% in July to 18.56 million metric tons month-on-month, the lowest level since February 2024, government data showed on Monday.

title: Mathura Man Attempts Suicide, Clings To Bridge Pillar, Called Out For Help, Saved By Cops
content: A 50-year-old man in the Vrindavan area of Mathura jumped into the Yamuna River allegedly with the intention of ending his life; however, he changed his mind at the last minute and started calling out for help.

title: Egyptian Jasmine Farmers Behind World's Perfumes Face Climate Fight Alone
content: A 2023 report by the International Energy Agency found Egypt's temperature rose 0.38C per decade (20002020), outpacing the global average.

title: 40% Passengers Unhappy With Toilet Hygiene On Long-Distance Trains: Report
content: The findings by the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) were based on a survey of 2,426 on-board passengers across 96 selected trains.

title: 4 Journalists Killed In Israeli Strike On Gaza Hospital
content: Four journalists were among at least eight people killed on Monday in a strike on a hospital in southern Gaza, including a freelancer who worked for the Associated Press.

title: India Hires 2nd Lobbying Firm In US Before Trump's Russian Oil Tariff Kicks In
content: Days before US President Donald Trump's punitive 50 per cent tariffs take effect on Indian exports, India's embassy in Washington has reportedly hired a second lobbying firm with close ties to the Trump administration.

title: Delhi Police Arrest Tailor For Strangling Woman Over Money Dispute, Tried Dumping Body
content: A 35-year-old tailor has been arrested for allegedly strangling a woman to death and trying to dump her body in a drain in Delhi's Dabri area after a dispute over money, the police said.

title: Inside Rekha Gupta Attack Plan: How Suspect Sourced Knife, Why He Threw It
content: Rekha Gupta was attacked by Rajesh Sakriya during a public hearing last week in the Civil Lines area of the city. He was subsequently arrested.

title: Ex-Top Court Judge Apologises After "Lady Lawyers Winked At Me" Remark
content: Former Supreme Court judge Markandey Katju has apologised after his comment about women lawyers drew strong condemnation from the Supreme Court Women Lawyers Association (SCWLA).

title: Man Kidnaps 1-Year-Old, Rescued After 41-Hour Search In Mathura: Police
content: A one-year-old girl abducted from Mathura Junction railway station late Friday night was traced within 41 hours near Agra Cantonment station by the Government Railway Police.

title: Akhilesh Yadav Vs Expelled MLA Heats Up With New Life Threat Allegation
content: Expelled Samajwadi Party MLA Pooja Pal on Monday wrote to party chief Akhilesh Yadav accusing him of shielding criminals and saying she fears the "SP-sponsored mafia" might get her killed.

title: Massive MBBS Admission Scam Busted, Students Used Fake NRI Documents
content: The investigation by the probe agency ED revealed that private medical colleges offered about 18,000 admissions in the MBBS course to students who used fake documents.

title: Delhi Metro Fare Hike: DMRC Increases Ticket Prices After 8 Years. Check Details
content: Delhi Metro Fare Hike 2025: Travelling in the Delhi Metro is set to become costlier after the DMRC hiked ticket prices by Re 1 to Rs 4 on all lines.

title: "Only Perseverance Is Required": What Shubhanshu Shukla Said To Students In Lucknow
content: "The entire landscape is changing, and I think the future is extremely bright," said astronaut and Indian Air Force Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla here on Monday, while stressing that it was only perseverance that has defined his success.

title: Chinese Woman Uses Grandchild's Fee To Treat Wrinkles. Wanted To 'Stop Husband From Cheating'
content: A woman in China spent 62,000 yuan, approximately Rs 7.5 lakh, on a wrinkle-removing treatment and the reason was shocking.

title: PM Modi Meets Fijian Counterpart Rabuka, Talks On Boosting Trade, Defence
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday held wide-ranging talks with his Fijian counterpart Sitiveni Ligamamada Rabuka, focusing on shoring up bilateral ties in areas such as trade and investment.

title: Final 53-man roster projections for every NFL team: What we learned in preseason Week 3
content: The NFL preseason slate is over, and teams have started making moves ahead of final roster cuts on Tuesday.

title: Bonzi survives Medvedev's meltdown, late surge
content: Daniil Medvedev and Benjamin Bonzi's match was delayed more than six minutes between points Sunday night after a photographer entered the court on match point.

title: Fleetwood wins Tour Championship, FedEx Cup
content: After many near misses, Tommy Fleetwood finally notched his first PGA Tour victory Sunday after posting a 2-under 68 to finish 18 under in the Tour Championship, three strokes ahead of Russell Henley and Patrick Cantlay at East Lake Golf Club in Atlanta.

title: Had it with heckler, Ohtani hits 45th HR in win
content: A heckler next to the Los Angeles dugout spent his entire Sunday giving an earful to the visitors, including a nonstop barrage of digs and chirps at Shohei Ohtani, before the Dodgers star crushed his 45th homer in an 8-2 victory over the San Diego Padres.

title: Source: U-M to name Underwood starting QB
content: True freshman Bryce Underwood is expected to be named Michigan's starting quarterback, a source confirmed to ESPN's Pete Thamel.

title: USMNT's McKennie target of racist abuse
content: USMNT's Weston McKennie was subjected to racist abuse after Juventus completed a 2-0 win over Parma in the Serie A, the Italian club said Sunday.

title: Grieving Chisholm's HR helps Yankees stop skid
content: Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s two-run home run in the second inning Sunday night at Yankee Stadium gave New York its first lead against the Boston Red Sox since Thursday night's series opener, and ignited a 7-2 victory for the Yankees, who improved to 70-60.

title: Chinese Taipei wins 18th LLWS title; 1st since '96
content: Chinese Taipei won its first LLWS since 1996, although its 18 titles are the most of any country besides the United States.

title: ⛳ Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win

content: Party president Pawan Kalyan will focus completely on JSP affairs during the three-day conclave, says the PAC chairman

title: Is India underestimating the cost of dealing with invasive species?
content: In a new assessment, plants have emerged as the most economically impactful invasive species worldwide as well as as the costliest group vis-à-vis the cost of management, demanding $926.38 billion in 1960-2022. Next in line were the arthropods ($830.29 billion) and mammals ($263.35 billion)

title: Fear of another defeat in Bihar polls is haunting Rahul Gandhi: Anurag Thakur
content: Anurag Thakur said Rahul Gandhi blamed EVMs after every electoral loss and now, before the Bihar election, he is making “making baseless statements about the Election Commission of India”

title: Pratap Bhanu Mehta warns of a crisis of democratic substance in Vision 2047 lecture

content: The IBCA is a multi-country, multi-agency coalition of over 90 big cat range countries and non-range countries with an interest in big cat conservation

content: The accused, a native of Baghpat in Uttar Pradesh, was allegedly in an intoxicated condition. He was apprehended on the spot and handed over to the police.

content: The force aims to achieve the target of 10% representation of women and an official says structured to that effect

content: Bench says public institutions cannot deny long-term ad hoc employees regularisation or basic pay parity by citing financial strain or lack of vacancies

content: States will be reduced to level of municipalities, B. Sudershan Reddy, Vice-Presidential candidate of INDIA bloc, says at meeting organised by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin and DMK alliance partners

title: Tariffs put on India to force Russia to stop war, says U.S. Vice-President Vance
content: The U.S. Vice-President says the step will “make it harder” for the Russians to get rich from their oil economy

title: Balakrishna finds place in World Book of Records, Naidu terms it historic milestone

title: Man arrested in Hyderabad for posting sexually explicit, communally sensitive content online

title: 17-year-old Adivasi girl ‘gangraped’ in A.P., found abandoned near Palvancha in Telangana’s Bhadradri Kothagudem district
content: Sources said the incident occurred when the girl was heading to her parents’ home in a tribal habitation in Chinturu from her relative’s house near Konta in Chhattisgarh

title: PM Modi degree row: Delhi HC quashes CIC order; DU not bound to share his 1978 BA records
content: The Delhi High Court overturned a Central Information Commission (CIC) order on Monday, which had instructed the disclosure of information pertaining to Prime Minister Narendra Modi's bachelor's degree. Justice Sachin Datta delivered the verdict following a petition from Delhi University challenging the CIC's directive.

title: What about leaders who ... : Kejriwal hits back at Shah's 'criminal bill' defence
content: Arvind Kejriwal has launched a sharp retort to Amit Shah's defense of the 130th constitutional amendment bill, which proposes disqualifying lawmakers jailed for over 30 days in serious cases. Kejriwal questioned the ethics of inducting criminals into parties and rewarding them with high office. Shah expressed confidence that the bill, aimed at upholding constitutional morality, would pass despite opposition.

title: 'They wanted Mercedes or Rs 60L': Kin of Noida dowry victim recall torture
content: Nikki, a 26-year-old woman, was allegedly murdered by her in-laws in Greater Noida for dowry, sparking outrage and demands for strict action. Her family recounts years of harassment, including physical assault and escalating demands for money and luxury items.

title: 'Hallmark of cowardly govt': Rahul after protesters lathicharged; 'time to fight back'
content: Congress leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, have strongly criticized the central government over the alleged lathi-charge on SSC aspirants protesting in Delhi, accusing the Modi government of ignoring the youth's concerns and manipulating elections. The leaders condemned the police action, while Delhi Police denied the lathi-charge, stating that some protestors were detained for refusing to leave after the permitted time.

title: Rohit Sharma meets fan girl, signs her painting, gesture goes viral - See pics
content: Rohit Sharma, adored by fans, recently charmed a young admirer with a signed portrait. He transitioned from Test and T20I cricket, potentially returning for an ODI series against Australia.

title: AI and jobs: Microsoft AI CEO to workers; My central worry is many will be left behind
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman cautions that AI's rapid advancement may outpace people's ability to adapt, leading to a significant skill gap rather than widespread job losses. He urges governments, companies, and educators to prioritize reskilling programs and digital literacy.

title: ITR filing: How to download Form 16? Step-by-step guide for taxpayers
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Salaried taxpayers preparing to file their Income Tax Return (ITR) for AY 2025-26, with a deadline of September 15, 2025, should have their Form 16 ready. This form, downloadable from the TRACES portal, details taxable salary income and taxes deducted.

title: No Sunil Chhetri! Khalid Jamil confirms 23-man squad for CAFA Nations Cup
content: Khalid Jamil has announced India's 23-member squad for the CAFA Nations Cup in Tajikistan, notably excluding veteran striker Sunil Chhetri. Mohun Bagan's players are unavailable, impacting selection. Anwar Ali, Naorem Mahesh Singh, and Jeakson Singh Thounaojam are included. India faces Tajikistan, Iran, and Afghanistan in Group B, with Jamil aiming to improve India's AFC Asian Cup qualifying performance.

title: Bengali actor and BJP leader Joy Banerjee passes away after prolonged illness
content: Bengali actor Joy Banerjee, a prominent figure in Tollywood during the 1980s and 90s, passed away at 63 in Kolkata on Monday. He was admitted to a private hospital on August 15, battling Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease. Known for hits like 'Hirak Jayanti' and 'Milan Tithi,' Banerjee also contested elections on a BJP ticket before resigning from politics.

title: Steve Jobs, who hated photos, once called a shot the ‘best picture of me’
content: In 2006, Albert Watson, a Scottish photographer, was tasked with capturing a portrait of the camera-shy Steve Jobs. Despite Jobs' initial reluctance, Watson's minimalist approach and direction led to a photograph that Jobs himself admired. Following Jobs' death in 2011, Apple used the portrait as a tribute, solidifying its place as a visual representation of his enduring legacy.

title: Israel hits Gaza hospital again, 15 dead including 4 journalists
content: An Israeli airstrike on Nasser Hospital in Khan Yunis, southern Gaza, resulted in at least 15 fatalities, including four journalists and a civil defense member. Reports indicate a "double-tap" strike, with initial and follow-up missiles targeting the area as rescue crews arrived. Several news agencies confirmed the deaths of their journalists and contractors in the attack.

title: UP: Shubhanshu Shukla meets CM Yogi Adityanath; family joins in
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, India's first astronaut on Nasa's Axiom-4 mission to the ISS, met Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow after returning from the US. He previously presented PM Modi with the Axiom-4 mission patch and shared photos of Earth from space. Shukla completed an 18-day mission, conducting over 60 experiments, marking a milestone for India's Gaganyaan programme.

title: Delhi Metro fare hike: DMRC raises prices starting today; check new rates
content: Delhi Metro fares have increased for the first time in years, impacting daily commuters. Effective Monday, fares are up by Rs 1 to Rs 4, with the minimum fare now Rs 11 and the highest Rs 64. Airport Express Line fares also see a rise. The DMRC calls the revision minimal but necessary to balance operational costs.

title: OpenAI hiring in India: Check job details, requirements and other information
content: OpenAI is coming to India with a new office in New Delhi. The company is hiring for Account Director positions. These roles span digital narratives, large enterprise, and strategic planning. OpenAI is offering hybrid work options. Sam Altman will visit India in September. ChatGPT Go is priced at Rs 399 per month.

title: India vs Pakistan at Asia Cup: 'Cross-border tensions still persist'
content: Amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi has appealed to the BCCI to reconsider India's Asia Cup match against Pakistan scheduled for September 14 in Dubai. Gogoi argues that playing cricket at this time would compromise national interest and undermine diplomatic efforts to hold Pakistan accountable.

title: Conor McGregor and Beckham share unforgettable yacht meeting during Italy holiday
content: UFC star Conor McGregor and football legend David Beckham had a chance encounter on the Amalfi Coast in Italy. McGregor, vacationing on his yacht, met Beckham, who was with his family on his own yacht. McGregor shared photos on Instagram, expressing his admiration for Beckham as a long-time inspiration and acknowledging the Beckham family's influence.

title: 'Jinnah's dream': Himanta slams Sayeda Hameed for 'legitimising infiltration'
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised activist Sayeeda Hameed for supporting illegal infiltration. Sarma accused Hameed of trying to make Assam part of Pakistan. He stated that Assam's identity is at risk because of such support. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju also attacked Hameed's statement. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed concerns about the rising population of illegal immigrants.

title: Jumped wall, threw phone in drain: How TMC MLA tried to evade ED
content: Trinamool Congress MLA Jiban Krishna Saha was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with the teachers' recruitment scam. Saha allegedly attempted to escape during the raid, throwing his mobile phones into a drain. The arrest follows previous action by the CBI in April 2023 and is based on an FIR related to irregularities in hiring schoolteachers.

title: Raja Jackson attack video shows Syko Stu left unconscious at KnokX Pro Los Angeles event
content: At a KnokX Pro Wrestling event in Los Angeles, Raja Jackson, son of Quinton “Rampage” Jackson, violently attacked Syko Stu, leaving him unconscious and convulsing. Despite Stu's critical condition, the match continued, sparking outrage online. The incident has prompted investigations, calls for accountability, and discussions about safety protocols in professional wrestling, with KnokX Pro and Quinton Jackson issuing statements.

title: YouTuber Sagar Kundu swept away while making video in Odisha
content: A 22-year-old YouTuber from Berhampur, Sagar Kundu, was swept away by strong currents at Duduma waterfall in Koraput district while filming a live video. Despite warnings from friends about the rising water level, he ventured into the stream.

title: Indonesia Boat Race: 11-year-old aura farmer makes festival a global phenomenon
content: An 11-year-old boy's viral dance moves have revitalized Indonesia's Pacu Jalur boat race, drawing record crowds and international attention. Rayyan Arkan Dikha's energetic performance at the bow of a boat has attracted millions of views, inspiring even international sports stars to join the craze.

title: Online Gaming Bill 2025: How many crores will BCCI lose after Dream11 exit? - Details inside
content: Dream11 is ending its title sponsorship of the Indian cricket team following the passage of the 'Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill 2025,' which led to the shutdown of their real money games operations.

title: Tripura woman tied, hair chopped off over affair charge
content: In Tripura's Udaipur, a woman named Purnima Das was publicly tortured, accused of an extramarital affair. A mob, allegedly instigated by BJP leaders, tied her up, forcibly cut her hair, and mocked her. The incident, filmed by onlookers, sparked outrage, but police have reportedly targeted the victim's relatives instead of the instigators.

title: ICSI CS Executive Toppers 2025: Tithi Bohra obtains AIR 1 for June session
content: The Institute of Company Secretaries of India (ICSI) has declared the CS Executive Programme June 2025 results, with Tithi Bohra securing the top rank. Surender Pal and Mogulapally Jyothi followed, achieving AIR 2 and AIR 3 respectively. Successful candidates can now advance to the CS Professional Programme after completing registration and practical training.

title: ‘It’s not freedom of speech’: SC pulls up Samay Raina for mocking disabled
content: The Supreme Court has instructed five social media influencers, including Samay Raina, to publicly apologize for mocking individuals with disabilities. This directive follows allegations of ridiculing people with Spinal Muscular Atrophy and blindness. The court emphasized that freedom of speech cannot infringe upon the right to dignity, and further decisions on penalties will be determined later.

title: First major contact since Op Sindoor: India alerts Pak on possible flooding
content: Despite the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty after the Pahalgam attack, India has alerted Pakistan about a potential flood in the Tawi River. The information was reportedly conveyed through diplomatic channels, marking a significant communication between the two nations amidst strained relations. Pakistani authorities have issued warnings for vulnerable areas following the alert.

title: 'Time for both to move forward': Netanyahu says Israel could withdraw from Lebanon
content: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu lauded Lebanon's commitment to disarming Hezbollah by 2025, envisioning a potential reduction in Israel's military presence in southern Lebanon. However, Hezbollah has rejected the disarmament plan, demanding Israeli withdrawal from contested areas and a halt to airstrikes. The group accuses Beirut of succumbing to US pressure, asserting the ceasefire only requires scaling back south of the Litani River.

title: Ottawa Pride parade: Event scrapped after pro-Palestinian protesters block route
content: Ottawa's Pride parade was abruptly cancelled after pro-Palestinian activists blocked the route, demanding Capital Pride support boycotts against Israel and apologize for officials boycotting the 2024 event. The group, Queers for Palestine, halted the march near Parliament Hill, leading to disappointment among participants. Despite the cancellation, the Pride street festival continued as planned.

title: 'Currently stable': Syko’s brother breaks silence after Raja Jackson attack
content: Independent wrestler Syko Stu was brutally attacked by Raja Jackson at a KnokX Pro Wrestling Academy event, resulting in severe injuries and an LAPD investigation. Stu's brother, Andrew, has released a statement confirming Stu is in critical care and warning fans about fraudulent GoFundMe campaigns.

title: Highway to hell? 68 dead in 113 crashes on Delhi–Gurgaon Expressway in 2025
content: In Gurgaon, a concerning number of accidents on NH8 prompted the traffic police to establish a special monitoring cell. Using advanced software, the cell detects stationary vehicles on the expressway within five seconds, enabling swift removal to prevent congestion and accidents.

title: Hyderabad man kills 5-month pregnant wife; dumps body parts in Musi river
content: In a shocking incident in Hyderabad, a man allegedly murdered his pregnant wife following marital discord. He dismembered her body and disposed of some parts in the Musi River. The accused, S Mahender Reddy, confessed to the crime after police found the victim's torso at their residence and grew suspicious during a missing person's report.

title: Fitch affirms India’s credit rating at 'BBB-': Trump’s tariffs seen as ‘moderate’ risk
content: Fitch affirms India's credit rating at 'BBB-' with a stable outlook, buoyed by strong growth and robust external finances, despite potential US tariffs. While these tariffs pose a moderate downside risk, their direct GDP impact is expected to be modest.

title: Not Gukesh, Anand! Meet only Indian to beat No. 1 Carlsen in classical with black
content: Karthikeyan Murali, the 26-year-old Grandmaster from Thanjavur, holds a unique place in Indian chess history. In 2023, at the Qatar Masters, he became the only Indian to beat Magnus Carlsen with the black pieces during the Norwegian’s 14-year reign as World No. 1. A two-time national champion, Murali’s accidental chess journey now carries one unforgettable milestone.

title: Rajasthan rain fury: Udaipur mine turns death trap; Amer fort's wall collapses
content: Heavy rains in Rajasthan have led to widespread flooding and tragic incidents, resulting in six deaths, including four minors. Dausa recorded the highest rainfall, causing severe disruptions and prompting rescue operations in several districts. Schools have been closed, and authorities are on high alert as the weather department forecasts continued heavy rainfall for the next few days.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara retires: Wife pens heartfelt note - 'You have been living by Bhagavad Gita'
content: Cheteshwar Pujara has retired from all forms of Indian cricket. His wife paid tribute to his career and calm demeanor. She reflected on his dedication to the sport. Pujara represented India in 103 Tests. He scored 7,195 runs. He is remembered for his resilience, especially in the 2018-19 Test series win in Australia. He expressed gratitude for representing India.

title: Tesla partners with DeepSeek & ByteDance to launch ‘Hey Tesla’ AI voice assistant in China EVs
content: Tesla is upgrading its EVs in China with an AI-powered voice assistant through partnerships with DeepSeek and ByteDance's Doubao LLM. This system enables natural voice commands for various functions, enhancing the driving experience. Powered by ByteDance's Volcano Engine, this move aims to localize Tesla's offerings and compete with domestic EV leaders in China's smart car market.

title: ‘Trump's way of dealing…’: Jaishankar asserts strategic autonomy
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar advocated for diversified supply chains, highlighting India's experiences with trade and strategic control. He confirmed ongoing India-US trade discussions, emphasizing the protection of Indian farmers' interests. Jaishankar addressed India's stance on Russian oil purchases, asserting the nation's right to make decisions in its national interest.

title: Happy Hartalika Teej 2025: Best Wishes, messages, images and greetings
content: Hartalika Teej is a festival celebrating the bond between Goddess Parvati and Lord Shiva. People send wishes for devotion, peace, and blessings. The festival inspires love, patience, and compassion. Prayers are offered for joy and prosperity. Quotes emphasize faith and strength. Heartfelt messages convey hope and spiritual upliftment. The occasion is for new beginnings and brighter days.

title: Elvish Yadav firing case: 2 shooters nabbed; Himanshu Bhau gang claims hit
content: Delhi police have apprehended two more individuals linked to the shooting at Elvish Yadav's Gurugram residence. This follows the arrest of a bike-taxi rider who provided the motorcycle used in the attack. Investigations revealed the 'Bhau gang' claimed responsibility due to allegations against Yadav for promoting a betting app, as law enforcement continues to pursue remaining suspects.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar’s resignation: Is ex-VP under 'house arrest'? Amit Shah responds
content: Union home minister Amit Shah addressed several key issues, stating that Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation was due to health reasons, dismissing political speculation. Shah defended the proposed Constitution amendment regarding the removal of ministers jailed for serious offenses, accusing the Opposition of resisting reforms.

title: ‘Do they teach history in Ohio?’: JD Vance mocked over WWII remarks
content: JD Vance faced widespread criticism for suggesting World War II ended through negotiations, defending Trump's diplomatic approach in Ukraine. Critics highlighted Germany's unconditional surrender after Hitler's suicide and Japan's surrender following atomic bombings, emphasizing the lack of negotiation. While some defended Vance, the focus remained on his historically inaccurate comparison.

title: Noida dowry murder: Nikki's father alleges Vipin killed her over ‘other woman’
content: Nikki Bhati died after allegedly being set on fire by her husband and in-laws over dowry demands, prompting her father's desperate plea for justice. Following this, Nikki's husband, Vipin, was shot in the leg during an attempted escape while in police custody.

title: Rajasthan: Overflowing dam creates huge crater; villages submerged, roads washed out
content: Relentless rainfall in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur has caused the Surwal Dam to overflow, leading to a massive crater and widespread flooding. Villages are submerged, forcing mass evacuations and disrupting relief efforts due to impassable roads. In Dausa, continuous rain has flooded neighborhoods and damaged infrastructure, while in Amer, a portion of the Rambagh wall collapsed, suspending elephant rides.

title: Denied money for gutkha, UP woman feeds poison to 3 children before ending her life
content: In a tragic incident in Uttar Pradesh's Chitrakoot, a 30-year-old woman allegedly poisoned her three young children and herself after an argument with her husband over her gutkha consumption. The woman and her two daughters, aged 2 and 4, died while receiving treatment at a Satna hospital in Madhya Pradesh. Her five-year-old son is currently in critical condition.

title: Online Gaming Bill: BCCI breaks ties with Dream11
content: The BCCI and Dream11 have ended their partnership following the passage of The Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025, which bans money-based online gaming. Dream11 has stopped all paid contests and shifted to a free-to-play model, while My11Circle has also suspended real money games. Both companies affirm their commitment to legal compliance and future updates.

title: Fantasy baseball news: Rangers, Mets, Brewers navigating injury issues
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . a pair of early games kick off today's action . the Pittsburgh Pirates host the Colorado Rockies at 12:05 p.m. and five minutes later, the Tampa Bay Rays entertain the Saints .

title: 2025 preseason College Football Playoff predictions
content: college football reporters predict the 12 schools that will make up the college football Playoff beginning in December . the odds are updated every week following that week's games . Ohio State won the inaugural 12-team bracket last season, despite starting as the no. 8 seed .

title: ⚾ The feud between Madonna and Evansville, IN
content: EVANSVILLE, INDIANA, is one of America's biggest small towns . residents are proud of their town's resilience during the 1937 flood . they're proud of the city's role in world war II as a major manufacturing hub .

title: Six unlikely CFP stars and what they do for an encore
content: wide receiver Jaden Greathouse will be different as no. 6 Notre Dame opens the season at no. 10 Miami . Greathouse entered the college football playoff semifinal at the orange bowl with only six receptions for 49 yards in his previous five games . the wide receiver had a career-high 66 receiving yards for the season .

title: ⚾ How Lucas Erceg uses his sobriety to inspire
content: the softball field at Boonville Correctional Center has two fences . the first is a standard outfield fence stretching from foul line to foul line . it's a stark reminder that the field is, quite literally, a diamond in the rough .

title: 💯 Ranking the top 100 college football players
content: a list of the top 10 college football players entering the season is no easy task . it requires a mix of information, reporting and assumptions . some choices are easy and some projections are nearly universally agreed upon . at least a few will be hisman Trophy contenders by season's end .

title: Tough draft-day decisions: Can you pick a top-five QB and top-three TE and like your team?
content: the fantasy football landscape changes every year to make us reconsider the way we approach drafts . an exciting rookie comes into the league and fantasy expectations go through the roof with the hopes of what could be . Become ESPN fantasy football's ultimate champ .

title: NFL preseason trade tracker: Every move leading up to the 2025 season
content: the NFL preseason is over, with all 32 teams prepping for the 2025 regular season . as teams continue to tinker with their final rosters, we're tracking every trade before the season kicks off on sept. 4 .

title: Rejuvenated Arsenal look the part of title contenders, but depth could be put to test
content: 5-0 demolition of Leeds united was a demonstration of the feel-good factor that outlay has created . but it also served as a warning that this deeper pool of options could be tested much sooner than the club hoped . eberechi Eze was unveiled 15 minutes before the start as arsenal's seventh summer signing .

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Orlando Pride are officially in a slump
content: alyssa Thompson scores for Angel City in the 86th minute to defeat Orlando 1-0 . the current continue to take care of business as far and away the league's hottest team . it's the 10th in a row without a loss for the league leaders .

title: The favorites to the underdogs: Ranking the US Open contenders
content: the new big two of men's tennis is overwhelmingly favored to make it three straight Slam finals against each other . Aryna Sabalenka is a brilliant 67-13 on the season but has fallen short late in all three Slams and must fend off a torrid Iga Swiatek .
